page.title: 03CLEVELAND SEARCH & RESCUE
page.content: Today many people enjoy walking the moors and hills. Some walk short distances while others enjoy long walks such as The Cleveland Way, which is also part of a 42 mile 24hr walk: The Lyke Wake Walk. It follows ancient burial routes. As well as enjoying fine panoramic views, there are fossils to be found on Cringle Moor. Occasionally walkers get into difficulties needing the assistance of Cleveland Search & Rescue. These are skilled and experienced walkers, well organized and equipped, who work in conjunction with the police, RAF & other similar teams. They undertake many hours of training and practice rescues. They agree to be "on call", and give their time without payment . They raise funds to provide their equipment, but do not ask for or accept money from those they rescue.
